The Office of African American Academic Acceleration’s third annual Summer Literacy Program starts June 8th! We’re excited to serve more students than ever this year with our first virtual programming model!

This five-week online reading program via Google Hangouts and other virtual platforms is focused on accelerating your child’s reading and will be an additional support to continue their academic growth in our current transition to distance learning. We’ll have independent reading with a teacher, targeted small group lessons, writing, family workshops and more.

If you have a child (or know one) that needs assistance with reading who currently attends Fresno Unified as a Kindergarten through 4th grade student and are interested in enrolling them in the program, please contact Brittany Collins at 415-496-9920 or brittany.collins@fresnounified.org. Spots are limited!

Congrats to Elementary & Secondary Education Champions (and sisters) Harmony Mendez and Melody Drumm!

Harmony is a music teacher at Fresno Unified School District Ayer Elementary School & Leavenworth Elementary School and Melody is a music teacher at Kratt Elementary, Starr Elementary School, and Tenaya Middle.

Harmony and Melody have gone above and beyond to ensure that their students' music education continue at home. They helped distribute technology, so their students had access to Smartmusic. Superintendent Nelson and our Board of Education just announced two big updates regarding graduation and summer learning.

First, we will not be able to hold a physical graduation in June as we had hoped. We are still committed to providing an in-person ceremony when it is again safe to gather in large groups.

Second, in lieu of a physical graduation we will be hosting virtual Senior Celebrations for our Class of 2020. These will be broadcast on local TV and online. More information including dates and times will be announced by May 15th.

Third, we will be offering summer learning opportunities to ALL students in a virtual distance learning format. More information, including how to register your child will be communicated in early May.

Please see the parent and student letters attached to this post and on our website at fresnounified.org.

Fresno Teachers Association
April 2 at 2:45 PM ·

Later today we are launching our first meal distribution for the students and families of Fresno Unified School District. We are also supporting local businesses in the process. Today's meals will be prepared by Quesadilla Gorilla.

Today's meal distribution is for the students and families in/near the Addams Elementary area. Please be mindful that we have a limited number of meals and want to be able to give them to those most in need.

Due to social distancing guidelines we prefer that participants drive up. We will hand over the meals. IF there are walk-up participants, they must maintain social distancing guidelines.

Special thanks to Live Again Fresno who will help us distribute the meals to families in the Parkway Drive area.

We plan to feed about 500 people per week in the various FUSD regions over the next several weeks.

As you may know, we've pledged at least $10,000 and have received many generous donations to help in this effort.

You can donate via:
GoFundMe: gofundme.com/f/FresnoConcert
Cash App: $fresnoteachers
Venmo: @fresnoteachers
